brief_summary.textblock:
Obesity is a major health issue worldwide; there is a constant raise in obesity related
      death each year.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Mate Extracts on Decrement of Body and Abdominal Fat in Obese Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of the study was to investigate the effect of Mate extracts in Korean
      subjects on body fat and abdominal fat, double blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial.

      Thirty obesity subjects with BMI ≥ 25 kg/㎡ and waist-hip ratio (WHR)≥ 0.90 for men and ≥
      0.85 for women were for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Volunteers aged 19 to 65 years

          -  25 kg/m2 ≤ BMI ≥35 kg/m2

          -  Ability to give informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Significant variation in weight (more 10%) in the past 3 month

          -  Cardiovascular disease, neurologic or psychiatric disease, renal, pulmonary and
             hepatic abnormalities

          -  History of disease that could interfere with the test products or impede their
             absorption, such as gastrointestinal disease (Crohn's disease) or gastrointestinal
             surgery (a caesum or enterocele surgery are included)

          -  Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to
             interfere with successful participation in the sutdy

          -  Allergic or hypersensitive to any of the ingredients in the test products

          -  Pregnancy or breast feeding

          -  Used antipsychosis drugs therapy within past 2 months

          -  History of alcohol or substance abuse (21 units/week over)

          -  Participation in any other clinical trials within past 3 months

intervention.description: Mate is a South American herb that is traditionally prepared as a tea and used, among others, for weight reduction.
intervention.other_name: Extracts of Ilex paraguariensis A. St.-Hil.

intervention.description: Amount and calorie of placebo are same with Mate extracts.

clinical_study.official_title: Mate Extract Supplementation Reduces Body and Abdominal Fat in Obese Korean Subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in body and abdominal fat
primary_outcome.time_frame: body fat: baseline, 6 weeks and 12 weeks, abdominal fat of CT: baseline and 12 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in anthropometric parameters(weight, BMI, waist and hip circumference)
Changes in blood lipid profile(total cholesterol, triglyceride, HDL-cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, free fatty acid)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
